page.title: 01A GENERAL VIEW - BROSELEY
page.content: This area shows mostly mixed and arable agriculture with rolling landscapes.The north-western area has deciduous trees growing on steep slopes above the{Ironbridge Gorge.}The south-eastern woodland is mixed,but mostly coniferous.{Broseley}and adjoining{Benthall}comprises the largest inhabited area.The shops are along the High street.Small industries are in the north-eastern area.Old mining shafts are found in this area,with modern open-cast coal mines and old clay mines to the south of {Benthall.}Smaller communities include {Posenhall,Barrow,Wyke,Tickwood}and around{Benthall Hall,}owned by the {National Trust.
